basics.name: Hayden Webb
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Undergraduate Researcher broadly interested in all things Robotics

courses: Algorithmic Robotics, Engineering Design Studio, Engineering Design Tools, Fundamentals of Robotic Manipulation, Fundamentals of Control Systems, Introduction to Operations Research and Optimization, Heat Transfer, Machines and Mechanisms, Modeling Dynamic Systems, Prototyping & Fabrication, Rigid Body Dynamics, Thermodynamics

publications.name: Robust In-Hand Manipulation for Parallel Jaw Grippers through Remote Center of Compliance and Active Surfaces
summary: Designing a robot hand for parallel jaw grippers to provide full spatial manipulation through the use of active surfaces, compliant fin-rays, and a remote center of compliance (RCC) beam system.
Developing a P-control manipulation algorithm utilizing force primitives to parameterize and test the handâ€™s manipulation capabilities for objects of variable geometry

publications.name: Wearable Roller Rings to Augment In-Hand Manipulation through Active Surfaces
summary: Designed in-hand manipulator for both human & robotic grasping systems for differential, non-holonomic, and full spatial manipulation.
Developed a generalized active surface-based motion model for arbitrary geometry objects

patents.name: Wearable Roller Rings to Augment In-Hand Manipulation through Active Surfaces

awards.title: 3rd Place, Student Mechanism and Robot Design Competition (SMRDC)
Asme Student Financial Support Award
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

Selected Projects.name: Electronic Prony Brake Torquemeter
summary: Designed and developed multiple functional 3D-Printed Prony Brakes to mechanically test the concepts of dynamic torque, speed, and power through inset motors and load cells.
Built an electronic subsystem consisting of a photo interrupter, Arduino microcontroller, and signal amplifier to calculate the torque and RPM of a motor for use in an upper level MECH course.

Selected Projects.name: Wearable Roller Rings to Augment In-Hand Manipulation through Active Surfaces
summary: Developed a convective body cooling suit for individuals to wear during 95+% humidity to cool down.
Designed a water-driven cooling subsystem with water-blocks located at high-temperature regions in the body to dissipate heat more effectively from the body.
Optimized design using calculations of  heat dissipation for intended use case in nominal human subjects.

Selected Projects.name: Grasping Aid Device for Arthrogryposis Multiplex Congenita (AMC)
summary: Manufactured an underactuated robotic glove for performing power & precision grasps in daily activities.
Built and assembled cable-driven mechanism for furling and unfurling of fingers.

Technical Experience.name: Co-President
summary: Managed and aided 10+ subteams and 50+ students on the development of various robotics projects
Developed new safety & testing procedures for R&D and Combat Robotics subteams
Organized and instructed several workshops, talks, and presentations on robotics and engineering skills

Technical Experience.name: Team Lead, Mirrored Robot Arm Subteam
summary: Led and built the mechanism manufacturing for a 6-DoF underactuated robot hand and arm
Integrated designed components with electronics package to allow for mirroring of human movement

Technical Experience.name: Team Lead, Highschool Aerospace Scholar
summary: Led 20+ students on the design of a theoretical human landing system between Gateway Space Station and the lunar surface utilizing integrated CAD environment
Collaborated with other teams to integrate Lunar Lander into theoretically designed Gateway Space Station for mock Artemis Mission

Teaching Experience.name: Head Teaching Assistant (ENGI 210 - Prototyping and Fabrication)
Teaching Experience.publisher: Rice Makerspace, Oshman Engineering Design Kitchen (OEDK)
summary: Taught material, hosted tutorials, and led workshops on engineering tools and fabrication methods
Assisted 30+ undergraduate & graduate students with team projects and individual competencies

Teaching Experience.name: Teaching Assistant (MECH 310 - Rigid Body Dynamics)
Teaching Experience.summary: Assisted with teaching and grading of material for 70+ undergraduate students

Teaching Experience.name: IBB Summer Academy Assistant
Teaching Experience.summary: Led week-long courses for high school students on engineering design tools, devices, and processes
